alert.note: Alert for Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 6:45AM EST until January 15 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey... Wanaque River At Wanaque Dam affecting Passaic County. For the Wanaque River...including Wanaque Dam...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wanaque River at Wanaque Dam. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, Open adjacent land begins to flood. Waters rise around Wilderness Island Park. At 6.0 feet, John E. Murrin Park begins to flood. Hershfield Park floods. The athletic fields begin to take on water. Parking lots and Hershfield Park Place floods. Carlough Field floods. At 7.0 feet, Back Beach Park in Wanaque begins to flood. The light industrial area off of Lakeside Avenue in Pompton Lakes floods. VFW Way in Pompton Lakes begins to flood. Backyards flood on Henderson Court and Hill Court in Pompton Lakes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:10 AM EST Saturday the stage was 5.4 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 6.9 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.9 feet on 03/19/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Stg Time Date Wanaque River Wanaque Dam 6.0 5.4 Sat 6 am 6.9 6.2 6.9 7am 1/14 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 645 PM EST.
